2017 WW02 NFVi Gold Release Announcement (BKC #1)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW02 NFVi Gold release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n Linux\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Ren, Shu.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
LinuxBKC-NFVi_Ubuntu14_13.110702-2017WW02.zip\n \n
\n 		BKC-NFVi_Ubuntu14_13.110702-2017WW02.zip\n \n
\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\n
\n\n
\n
\n   Summary \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

Key Updates

    \n
  • This is the\n initial NFVi release based on AT&T AIC project \xe2\x80\x93 Day1 configuration\n requirement
    • \n
  • The release\n is based on Ubuntu14.04.5 with kernel 3.13.0-85 generic
    • \n
  • Please refer\n to the HW/SW ingredient table below for detailed configuration
    • \n
  • QAT is\n integrated in the BKC package but it hit an installation issue with\n current configuration, so no QAT validation coverage in this release so far
    • \n
  • Total test\n cases (w/o QAT): 74; Attempted test\n cases: 74 (Attempted\n rate: 100%);\n Passed test cases: 69 and pass\n rate is 93.24% .5 test cases failed linked with 4 sightings. Please\n visit HPQC for test details
    • \n

Key Issues

    \n
  • 5345808 - [NFVi_WFP][WW02] system will crash\n when\n install\n QAT acceleration
    • \n
      \n
    • Issue shows\n with integrated Lewisburg-L B1
      • \n
    • QAT 1.7 could be installed successfully with Lewis Hill by WAR to disable integrated QAT
    • \xe2\x80\x9ctiger team\xe2\x80\x9d has been formed to fix the issue 
      • \n
    \n

Release Note

    \n
  1. This build\n only contain the SW package, no auto-installer support
    2. \n
  2. Installation\n step: 
    3. \n
    \n
      \n
    • Install\n Ubuntu14.04.5 Server
      • \n
    • Download\n the SW package and unzip it, Copy the APP folder to /opt/ of target SUT
      • \n
    • Navigate to\n /opt/APP/script, run update_kernel.sh to update kernel to 3.13.0-85,\n reboot the system 
      • \n
    • Navigate to\n /opt/APP/script, run setup.sh to install required libs and SW dependencies
      • \n
    \n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n

Note: All SW ingredients\nare released by source code, refer to README for installation details

InformationQuick Guide
BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website:  https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Click on "Add or Remove access"
  • Navigate to:"BKC \xe2\x80\x93 NFVi"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Ren, Shu

BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication
